info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 8:35PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...AN AREA OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN GREENE...NORTHERN MONONGALIA...NORTHEASTERN WETZEL...MARSHALL AND NORTHWESTERN MARION COUNTIES THROUGH 915 PM EDT... At 835 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hundred, or 9 miles northwest of Mannington, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Morgantown, Waynesburg, Westover, Star City, Granville, Fairview, Hundred, Cassville, Rogersville, Bobtown, Blacksville, and Spraggs. This includes the following highways... Interstate 68 in West Virginia between mile markers 6 and 7. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 17. Interstate 79 in West Virginia between mile markers 152 and 160. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for southwestern Pennsylvania...and northern West Virginia.
